title: Fantastic
text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights from 18-23rd December 2022. The hotel is situated very close to Times Square, under a 10 minute walk. It was around a 20-25 minute walk to Central Park & similar to the Empire State Building. We did not need to use the subway at all as we seemed to be in walking distance to most things which was great. On one day we did get the Big Bus Tour to downtown to see world trade centre, Statue of Liberty but on another day we walked from the hotel and did the high line to Chelsea Market. The hotel staff were all fantastic. Every time we entered the reception area they were so polite, friendly and helpful. The reception area was very fresh, modern and clean. There was always icy cold water for free available by the bar with paper cups which was a nice gesture, we always took a cup of water up to the room each once our bottle of water included in the service charge ran out. The room itself was small, like most city hotels but was very clean, modern and the bed was very comfy and the shower was great. Just what we needed at the end of a busy walking day around the city. The hotel offer pastries such as crossiants etc in the morning and this is served in the bar area and a first come first served basis from 7am. They don’t advertise this as ‘breakfast’ but is plentiful for most people. We never made use of this as we always went out for breakfast but often we would leave the room between 8-9am and there was always crossiants left! We took the air train from the airport to Jamaica and then took the Long Island rail road from Jamaica to Penn station and then walked to the hotel from there. This was cheap and relatively straight forward with Google maps on my phone. We took an Uber from the hotel to the airport in the morning as we left the hotel at 4am. Definitely recommend this hotel if you are planning a trip to New York

title: Will 100% return
text:
Now that the jetlag has finally worn off, I can review the stay at Pestana CR7 Times Square from 9 - 16 Oct. It's the first time I've stayed in a hotel for a whole week and it took about 5 hours of research and bookmarking and comparing the numerous options in Manhattan before landing on Pestana. And holy wow it didn't disappoint. 
The staff were smiling, friendly, shout out to Marilyn who is an absolute angel, but also to her coworkers who always greeted us with a smile and sincere pleasantries. It felt like returning home after a long day of working/conference hopping.
The perfume of the lobby was a great first impression, as well as the decor. It felt bright and modern, with TV screens playing games/news. The gym was clean, with freshly rolled towels and to our surprise some Peloton machines. The elevator never took more than a minute to arrive (which is something I read about in the other Manhattan hotels).The room was lovely. It was smartly laid out, great lighting and view from the window. It's really difficult these days to find a hotel with an opening window for actual fresh air!! Shower was spacious and constant working hot water. The air con worked very fast and well. The desk was more than enough space for our early 4am remote working hours (an important request for a desk that was honoured by the staff) The nespresso machine was a saviour (although, we ended up buying some more pods from Macy's to mix it up a bit). The cleaning staff did great, and we wanted to leave a note but forgot to so please pass on our thanks. The bed was HUGE and comfortable, which has given us bed envy now that we're home to our normal one. The location is so central that coming back at 2am from Brooklyn felt like an easy task and it was right near the conference so it was a really stress-free time. 
All in all, 5 stars and will be back next time without hesitation.

title: Overall, our stay was quite pleasant.
text:
tl;dr: Despite a notable lack of amenities, our overall stay was quite pleasant. The staff was, in general, accommodating and friendly. The location is fantastic and within walking distance of many attractions. We would seriously consider staying here again, albeit with some additional planning to compensate for the lack of amenities.

We booked the basic "Comfort" room for a week-long stay in Manhattan for ComicCon. We requested an ADA compliant room for the larger bathroom after reading some reviews that complained about its tiny size and unintuitive shower door. The front desk staff were very accommodating upon check-in and explained the process of using our room keys to operate the elevator. By the way, this place doesn't have door handles at the main entrance. It took me an embarrassing amount of time to realize I needed to wave my hand in front of the wheelchair button on the wall to even get in the lobby.

When we entered the room, we were pleasantly surprised by the size because, again, we had read reviews that said the room was very small. Our fortune may have been due to the ADA compliance, so take this with a grain of salt. Our room had very little street noise because we were located on the 14th floor, so your experience on lower floors may be different.

When we inspected the room, everything appeared clean and fresh. However, there was a notable lack of basic amenities. No refrigerator, no microwave, no desk to sit at. There was a mini bar, but we never even opened the door. After settling in, we found out there were also no ice machines. We enjoy our beverages ice cold, so calling down to the front desk for ice quickly became a nuisance, both for us and apparently for the staff. They started forgetting about our requests after a couple of days, so we went down to the bar and requested ice in person. The bartender was always very kind to us.

The ADA compliant bathroom was spacious enough and stocked with shampoo, body wash, and hand soap. The shower was fully functional with a handheld shower head, a regular shower head, and a shower seat. There was, however, a strange lack of towel racks and toilet paper holders. Generally speaking, the entire room felt unfinished, not "understated".

Aside from the stark absence of amenities, our stay was relaxing and enjoyable. Food deliveries were quick and easy as long as you wait in the lobby for your order. Almost everything you could want to see in Manhattan is a stone's throw away and, if you avoid the Lincoln Tunnel end of 39th, you won't see too many sketchy individuals.

If Pestana CR7 were to include basic amenities, I could find no reason to stay anywhere else when visiting Manhattan. It's very tempting to come back, but we will be shopping around for complete amenity satisfaction before booking here again.

Personal note: The front desk staff were an acceptable level of nice as a whole, although they still subscribe to traditional, gendered greetings (Mr., Ms., etc.). I was referred to as both during my stay from various staff members, and although I don't mind being misgendered due to my androgynous presentation and gender non-conformity, I would highly advise the staff here to not use gendered greetings. Someone who is transitioning or simply not conforming to gender norms can be especially sensitive to being misgendered, and it can cause a whole host of emotional responses. ComicCon attracts people from all walks of life, and being more inclusive can really set a business apart from its competition.

title: Exactly as advertised and will stay here again
text: Stayed 4 nights in 2 rooms, both with two double beds. Me and my oldest son in one room, my MIL and youngest son in the other room. Rooms were clean, staff were very helpful and friendly, and location s great—very close to Times Square. We had never been to NYC and had a wonderful time. We would definitely stay here again! Other reviewers complain of extra charges and problems with refunds—this is because they booked through a 3rd party site (like this one) and did not read the fine print. All NYC accommodations have a bunch of additional taxes and charges and they are the same no matter which hotel you stay in. The difference is that some hotels advertise the daily rate including an estimate of these charges and some don’t. Additionally, agreements may vary when using a 3rd party site (like this one) vs booking through the hotel’s website. Also, it’s NYC—all accommodations are small and compact. Plus, you’re there to see the city, not hang out in a hotel room all day. Lastly, the hotel doesn’t advertise a continental breakfast and why would they when just out the door are dozens of affordable places to grab a bite.

title: Scammers, junkies and terrible lighting
text:
Arriving at the hotel after a long day of travelling, we were astounded to find out we were going to be charged $26 per night per room for a facilities fee. (Please note, this is on top of a resort fee). The facility fee included all the items you’d expect in a basic hotel stay; wifi, gym and coffee. I scoured the booking website before booking and could not find mention of this anywhere. I cannot believe we had to pay this and have never been charged this whilst staying at a hotel in New York before. The staff were rude and blunt when dealing with this. 

The second and biggest issue was the street this hotel was unfortunately located on. Please do some research on the opioid crisis especially in New York City. This hotel is on one of the worst streets for drug addicts in the whole city. During our 5 night stay, we saw someone inject drugs, a group of people smoke crack outside the hotel entrance, and a drug deal taking place. Maybe it’s because we aren’t used to this in England, but we were all really shocked and scared walking to our hotel, especially after dark. We ended up getting an Uber back if it was late as we didn’t feel safe.

My final negative is relating to the lighting. It is SO dark in the rooms. There’s no ceiling light and you’re relying on the bathroom light and tiny bedside lights to get around. There’s no sunlight either as you’re opposite another tall building. I had to use my phone torch in the day to use the plugs and doing my makeup was a daily challenge.

On a positive note, the rooms and hotel was modern and the staff always said hello. The tiny rooms didn’t bother us as we were out most of the day but we definitely wouldn’t return, and would encourage others to book elsewhere and pay a little more.

Al día siguiente el director del Hotel después de haber recibido la crítica a través de la aplicación de la página web, subió hablar con nosotros, en la que le expliqué todo lo que nos había pasado, me propuso un upgrade y a la que le dije qué prefería que mirase en qué planta se encontraba ya que para tener el mismo problema, nos quedamos donde estábamos, ustedes han vuelto a saber de él? porque yo tampoco, no se dignó ni en darnos una respuesta… VERGONZOSO
El sonido de la calle se mete muchísimo en las habitaciones y es imposible descansar, El aire acondicionado al tener la máquina dentro hace muchísimo ruido, los colchones de mala calidad, limpieza de moqueta que deja mucho que desear, el baño TUVIMOS QUE EXIGIR QUE LO LIMPIASEN, porque solo cambian las toallas y nada mas.
HABITACIONES DIMINUTAS, no puedes ni dejar la maleta…
El personal de recepción poco profesional, si pides algo olvídate que te ayuden (pedi un poco hielo y el chico calvo con barba me emplazo a comprarlo en una tienda!!)
La ubicación en una calle muy sucia y llena de vagabundos e insegura.

title: Good choice
text:
This is a really nice hotel.

We have just returned from a 4 night stay in NYC and stayed in this hotel for the first time.

Check in was easy, the staff are polite and helpful. I had read some reviews where guests were unhappy that the room charge was different from the charge when booking as the facility fees/taxes etc were not included when booking, but I checked with hotel before arrival how much the total would be including all fees, so there were no surprises when I handed over my card.

The rooms are nice, clean, with comfortable beds. We got two Comfort Double rooms (2 double beds in each room) which were tight and left little space to walk around the beds. But they were fine. The bathroom/shower is compact, but modern and very good. The only downsides  were the extremely noisy aircon units, they are like having a diesel car in the room. If you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs.

The hotel is situated within a 5 min walk of Time Square, and 10 mins to Macy’s. There is good shopping close by and a really good pub across the street called The Joyce, the food there is excellent, But, brace yourself for the amount of drug addicts who congregate on 39th and surrounding streets, this part of the city from Time Square to Penn Station has a rep for drug dealing, and unfortunately it is all too visible at all times of the day/night.

Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Pestana CR7, I would recommend this hotel, but the area leaves a bit to be desired.

title: Average - Not Horrible, but Not Glamorous
text:
I honestly cannot complain all that much and will say that I would stay here again if I were to visit NYC again (which I am sure I will), but I would probably look for other options first. 

Price wise it was much more affordable than most other hotels in the area and it was no more than a 10 to 15 minute walk from pretty much everything which was great. The rooms were really small (it's New York so that's pretty much the norm everywhere), but it lacked certain things you'd hope to see in a hotel room. The fridge was super small and never got very cold and there wasn't a microwave which I would have liked to see. Also there are no ice machines on premise and you have to call for someone to bring you some. Another odd thing is that we couldn't get any of the outlets to charge our phones with multiple known good power supplies and charging cables. I'd plug in and go to bed with it at 30% for example and wake up six hours later and it was only at 38% charged. 

The staff in the lobby were always very friendly and welcoming and the few times we needed to have anyone come bring us something they were nice and accommodating. My main issue is that we had to call to have someone up to service our room. Yes, there were days when we had the door tag set to no, but we would set some garbage outside the door yet when they'd come to clean other rooms on our floor they never took it away. When we did have the tag set to yes no one ever came in to clean while we were out and about. Again, we had to call down and ask for someone to come in to clean and restock the towels.

The hotel states they have a restaurant that offers breakfast (not included and you'd have to pay) and bar for guests, but this alleged restaurant was non-existent and all they offered were some free day old bagels and croissants each morning. Also the bar was only open on the weekends and we never really utilized it as we'd be out doing other stuff and they closed rather early.

There was a gym with a Peloton bike in the basement which we were stoked to see (we both drink the Kool-Aid and were excited to be able to get in our daily workouts), but it needs to be recalibrated badly as it is very off. The basement area where the gym is at also has a weird smell to it. It looked clean, but just had this off putting smell to it. Musky bleach would be the best way to describe it.

All in all, like I said for the price and the location I am not going to nitpick and gripe too much, but I am sure with some more research there are other options around their price point that are much better.

title: Good location, friendly staff, a lot of minor issues
text:
Pros:
- Great location. It is in a quiet street in midtown so no issues with noises when going to bed. Close to train stations. And in within walking distance to Time Square, Broadway, etc. 
- Very friendly staff 
- Modern and clean facilities. Common area on the first floor is spacious. Gym is clean and with modern and working equipment (treadmill, Peloton bike, elliptical, free weights). 

Cons:
- Inefficient reservation protocol. I booked a room directly through their website and needed to change to upgrade to a bigger room. I called the hotel directly and was told to call a number in Portugal that handles the reservations. No luck, noone was answering for more than an hour. I emailed and did not get a response. I used the chat link in the site and had to wait for more than 20 minutes before I can reach someone. But was also disconnected. Reached out through IG and finally had a success there. 
- The hairdryer in our room was not working. It took an hour before we can get our hands on a working hairdryer (calling the reception twice and going down to the reception twice as well). 
- There is a coffee pot in the common room but the 3 days I was there, I did not managed to get a hot coffee. It is either empty or cold.  
- Rooms are small, hard to open up multiple suitcases. Also, there isn't enough light in the room. Our superior double room had 3 lights on our night stands and that was it to light the whole room.

Tea/coffee in the room and wifi are basic hotel amenities that should be included in the price - the fitness facility is fine but not something that interested us and yet we had to pay for it - maybe this should be an optional extra cost? $25 a night on top of the hundreds of dollars we had already paid just seems excessive.Overall, despite a fairly positive experience,  the facility fees and what they offer mean we wouldn't stay with this specific hotel again

title: Great stay!
text:
I booked this hotel for a work trip before I started reading the reviews and got REALLY nervous after the recent negative comments. However, I was pleasantly surprised with my stay. 

Here are a list of things I think some of the other reviewers got wrong:

1. I’m going to guess that some of the past reviewers did not read the details. I booked through hotels.com AND skimmed through the amenities on the website. I found the information to be pretty straightforward, including the amenities fees. And the hotel sends you daily emails leading up to the trip confirming and reconfirming any costs and updates for your trip. 
----Any trip you plan, you have a set of non-negotiables, you do your research, and adjust your expectations. Just read the details. If you read something that you know you won’t tolerate, then look for other options.  

2. I truly believe you are not going to find spacious accommodations in NYC unless you are willing to pay extra for that kind of space. With that being said, the hallways are small and you may hear people get on or off the elevator— like most hotels in major cities. If you want something quiet, then you’re better off gambling with Airbnb or booking a place in Jersey City or Hoboken. But even during my stay, I did not experience much noise in the hallways, and my room was directly across from the elevators.  

3. Customer service was amazing. I did not experience any of the negative things that past reviewers wrote. I believe the staff is truly listening and working to address the recent reviews. But I’m also sure if you treat the employees like the human beings they are, then maybe you will see that they ARE trying to help you but it can be hard to tell when you are yelling at them for things that could be out of their control bc they have management to answer to and if you ever worked in the service industry, you would know this. Everyone was great. Including Emily, Destiny, Marilyn, Ryan, and whoever made me an iced americano one morning even though it was not on the menu. 
------ And even well before the trip, I would call and ask a few one off questions (like the cost of incidentals=$100/day and etc…). The phone was ALWAYS answered after 1-2 rings by a real employee and I was never put on hold.  During my stay, I felt comfortable walking up to the front desk bc they never made me feel like I was bothering them.  

4. The nespresso machine was one of the reasons I booked this hotel. I loved it!

Some things to note:
- Not all rooms have a desk. I knew the rooms were going to be small after reading reviews, but I was surprised that I did not have one in my room. It ended up being fine because it just forced me to get out of the hotel and enjoy the city. There are plenty of coffeeshops around with wifi and a great working set up in the lobby. Most of the time, you will find others working in the lobby as well, so it is really quiet for a public space. 

- My room did not have a microwave so if you are hoping to “eat in” then this might not be the place for you. But there was plenty of fridge space even with the pre-stocked minibar 

Overall my stay was great.

title: Terrible
text:
Location is excellent. Beds super comfy! However the hotel service..... Bad. Flight was cancelled and hotel informed of this. We arrived 24 hours late, exhausted from our horrendous flight trauma of having to go from a direct flight to two flights. Turning up at 16.30pm 24 hours later to be told our room wasn't ready. It's 16.30 and it's not ready? I get they can't hold our room as our flight was cancelled but not to be ready when we informed them that we would arrive (24 hours later) I think is terrible. (we also wasn't given a refund for the night we wasn't there, which I get) 
We paid for a superior king room, yet the room is tiny and at the back of the building, when we questioned this the answer we got was its new york. Ey? Ive stayed in new york before and paid for a three star standard room and it was a lot bigger. Don't be so condescending with the answer of its New York! We said it's a comfort plus looking at your photos on your website and it states that all comfort plus are situated at the back of building. Yet we are at the back of the building and told we're In a superior king?
You get one bottle of water for the entire stay (1 bottle per room) 
Tea bags don't get refilled, when asked at reception if they get refilled we got a reply of I'm not sure? Yes we was then given a box of tea to choose from but only had one breakfast tea bag. Shower had a long black hair on the tiles when we turned up, on our last night this is still here, near the top of the shower head, also a piece of skin is on the carpet!  (vile) and still not been vacuumed. The shower head was hanging out that we had to put back ourselves. 
This superior king that you pay extra for is in the corner at the back behind the lift, therefore all night and morning you hear the arrival "ding" noise.
If you stay here don't pay for superior, pay for comfort room as the same room.
Good luck

title: shady and accusatory
text:
my experience at Pestana was unfortunately a disappointing one. first off, the lobby has a pungent odor every time we entered. although we upgraded our room to the superior king, it was average.

the reason why we gave it 1 star is because we were charged $5 for water that we did not even drink. i called the hotel staff and they insisted that we drank the water. after putting me on hold 3 times to confirm with housekeeping, they still wrongly accused me. at this point, i am more disappointed in the fact that they choose not to believe me as a guest who stayed there for 4 days and even tipped their housekeeping $15 at the end of our trip. it's not about the $5, but rather insisting that we were lying. eventually after having to speak to their supervisor, they refunded me this amount. why did it have to take all of that to get a refund?

we stayed in soho at the end of our trip at another hotel and realized two days after check out that we left a shopping bag full of $70 worth of items in our hotel. we called and asked Pestana to see if they had it. my mother works as a housekeeper at the Hyatt and the protocol is to leave left items in lost and found. Hyatt takes stealing seriously.. unfortunately, Pestana does not. after waiting 4 hours for them to check, they could not find our shopping bag. it just seems so shady that not only did they charge me for an item that i did not take in the hotel room, but they also somehow can't find my bag full of newly purchased items? they said that it was likely thrown away... which makes no sense especially since the items in there were clearly not garbage.

i definitely won't be back at this location or any other Pestana hotels.

title: Assez déçue
text:
Je ne sais pas trop quoi penser de mon séjour de 1 semaine à l'hôtel pestena cr7...

A peine arrivées on nous demande de payer 160€ de frais qui étaient censés déjà être réglés avec l'agence de voyage. Pas le choix de payer sinon on nous pouvait pas être enregistrées?? (Alors que je le rappelle tout était déjà payé en amont). Et pour combler tout ça nous étions obligées de payer en carte bancaire et non pas en espèce ce qui nous a évidement rajouté des frais en plus.

Les chambres sont très mal insonorisées, impossible de passer une nuit sans se réveiller plusieurs fois entre le bruit des Klaxons, les sirènes de police ou encore votre voisin de chambre qui claque la porte sans cesse. 

La propreté est également à revoir (poussière partout)

De plus, dès notre premier jour nous nous retrouvons avec les toilettes bouchées (heureusement le personnel a était très réactif et a vite réglé notre problème)

Quant au petit déjeuner il était plutôt bon avec pas mal de choix mais bon courage pour trouver une table ou vous asseoir! Ce n'est pas parce que la salle est remplie mais parce que le personnel ne se presse pas pour débarrasser donc il ne reste plus de couverts propres, obligé d'aller en réclamer.

Malgré ça les lits sont confortables et le personnel est très agréable, toujours la pour vous venir en aide. 

Et un grand merci à Marilyn qui était particulièrement présente pour nous, elle faisait beaucoup d'effort pour nous comprend et pour qu'on la comprenne aussi.

title: Avoid
text:
The staff did try to help with the unethical business practices of the hotel which was appreciated.

I question the validity of the positive reviews given my experience.  

"Resort fees" on top of your room charge are added for things that are shown to be included in the room & hotel,-such as the coffeemaker in the room.  They blamed it on Hotels.com who blamed it on Pestana.

The room is about half as big as what is advertised which deceives guests & is unfair to other hotels who are honest about room size. See photos.  

That coffeemaker for which I was charged an additional $22 each night stopped working. After 3 requests, a functioning one was provided.

The sink is maybe 2" deep without a working stopper making its use difficult & messy.

There is not a mini-frig but a "micro-frig" about half the size.

Lighting is minimal so getting work done there 

Is tough. 

They bottle their own Dollar General-like bath products.

There are no visible covid safety practices. No employees were masked even housekeeping & maintenance coming into rooms.

I'd requested no cleaning & put the privacy tag on my door only to come back to find my room had been entered. 

Security is lax as no key is needed to enter building at night when there was not always anyone at the front desk.

Hotels.com posted a $30 food & beverage credit with the booking. After booking, they told me they do not serve food, -only soft drinks & snacks as mini bar items. 

They can clearly see what's posted on the site & need to honest, transparent & responsible in marketing.

title: Good location, very small room
text: Good location near to times square, vessel and metro line. Clean and nice, but rooms are really really small, no space even for the bags, barely space to walk around the bed. Dissapointed, would not repeat.

title: I paid the price of bad customer service
text:
It was a bit loud at night. The hotel can't help people driving by with loud music, but you can even hear the ding of the elevator and people going into their rooms.  

I was so let down by the customer service. My flight was cancelled, so I wasn't going to make the first night of my hotel reservation. I called Pestana once and explained the situation to a rep, only to be put on hold for 5 minutes until they hung up on me (perhaps accidentally). I called back again, this time explaining my situation to a different person who wrote down my number and said they would call me back. No one called back. I showed up the next day and they had given away my room because I no-showed and didn't let them know, which I had two calls on my phone to prove that wasn't true. The rep found me a room to stay in, but I ended up paying for the room that I didn't stay in and was also charged the cleaning fee for the night I didn't stay there. On top of that, I was placed in a less expensive room. I have to travel to work each month and will never stay here again.

text:

title: Reasonable, comfy, and convenient.
text: Conveniently located, very comfortable bed, and a helpful friendly staff. Would have liked some overhead lighting, but that is a minor issue. The space is used very efficiently with additional storage space under the bed. They have a small kitchen as well as a bar downstairs where you can hangout if you’re waiting to meet someone.

title: Very pleasant stay at the center of the city
text:

The staff we came across with was very nice, friendly and welcoming, on of them even giving us inside tips for some attractions in the city! 

The hotel is located 5 minutes walking (maybe less if you walk at the speed rate of New Yorkers!) from the Times Square and from the train station that leads directly to the Newark airport (I'm not sure about the other airports, but I believe the situation is very much the same). This allowed us to do a lot of seightseeing simply by walking around the blocks!

I highly recommend this hotel, it was a very positive experience.

title: Can improve
text:
Our room was big enough and confortable. The hotel is well located and near everything by a walking distance.
The problems occurred when paying on the check in. they claimed the payment failed 2x and wanted us to try a 3rd time. We check our bank information, and contacted them, and they confirm BOTH payments were done correctly and were on the hotel's side. Front desk staff didn't provide for solutions but were kindly enough to let us do the check-in and only pay the deposit.
Every day we asked front-desk if they had more information regarding the payments and they never tried to provide with solutions. Thankfully on day 3 or 4 we found the hotel's manager and after explaining everything to him he promised to contact someone to verify the payments.

Only when we checked-out front-desk called the manager too see if he had updated regarding our situations and he confirmed the double payment.
Now we are waiting up to 21 BUSINESS DAYS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! to received something that is OURS!!!!
Same thing with the deposit, why the hell does it take 21 BUSINESS DAYS TO RETURN MONEY?????????

Also, for everyone who plans to stay here: the deposit is 400 dollars and you also have to pay the city tourist (?).

Great service and clean rooms!! big recommendation

title: A week long of smiles
text:
I only got to stay in the hotel for a week, but I can say that it has been one of the best places I’ve stayed in, mainly because of all the staff. Before even arriving in NYC, the company I made the reservations through had a failure in their system, and since they were taking too long to help me, I contacted the hotel directly and not only they solved the issue in seconds but also answered all of my questions.

Checking in was so easy, Marilyn is definitely the-best-person we met in all Manhattan! She was incredibly nice and so patient with us. She made sure we felt welcomed from the moment we stepped in the hotel to saying goodbye with the kindest words and smile, and we feel very lucky to have met her.

Giovanni was also there to welcome us and he was always so sweet. It was definitely a good feeling to see and talk to them between the chaos of rain, cold and crowds of Manhattan.

The room was always spotless, and the housekeeping staff was also so nice and always ready to help. Thank you for everything!

If you had any doubts on choosing this hotel, trust me everyone is really nice, the room is great, and the location is literally close to everything. I can’t wait to visit it again!

Little side note: I witnessed some rude hotel guests making a fuss about the smallest thing, and I cannot believe how professional the staff was in handling the issue. Please be nice to the staff, it takes more energy to be mean and everyone is doing their best!

title: Weekend Getaway!
text: My son and I had a great experience. We were immediately greeted at the front door. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. We loved having nearby parking and you cannot beat the location. Were were in walking distance to Madison Square Garden for the Rangers game, we walked to Times Square at night, and walked to The Edge at Hudson Year, which I highly recommend, the next day. As expected, the room was small, but is was very clean and modern. Even the little bathroom was adorable. After all, isn't it all about location and not how big your room is? For us location/affordability was most important. I highly recommend!

title: Vacaciones
text:
Estuvimos alojados 8 noches
Nos parecio un htl super limpio y muy bien ubicado
Destaco la amabilidad de Marilyn en recepción que nos hablaba en español y todos los dias estaba preocupada porque pasaramos bien con consejos y datos interesantes

title: Perfecte uitvalsbasis!
text: Wij verbleven hier voor ons bezoek aan New York. Gelegen in times square. Met goede uitvalbasis voor de bezienswaardigheden. In de buurt liggen vele leuke eetgelegenheden. Kamers zijn klein maar zeer functioneel ingericht. Goede bedden. Elke dag werd de kamer schoongemaakt. We hadden een aangenaam verblijf

title: Magnífica opción en Manhattan
text:
Calidad/Precio es una de las mejores opciones de Times Square. Hotel sencillo y moderno cerca de las mejores combinaciones de metro, restaurantes y locales ora desayunar. Personal joven y amable que domina varios idiomas. Limpieza y buen tamaño de habitaciones (el baño algo justo). Mi mujer sufrió los últimos días por alergia a la moqueta, pero fue una de las mejores estancias que hemos tenido en NY. 

Repetiremos!

title: Hotel
text: The Hotel is very well located. Even it’s in the center of the city, the room is very quiet. With all the commodities you may need, it is clean and cozy. The staff is very friendly, doing there best to make me feel comfortable in a strange city, always caring and available to help. Thank you all for making me feel almost home, in a special way thanks to Raquel and Marilyn, you do light up the reception area 😉 To the two guys who took care of the check-out and kept my luggage till I leave the city, thank you to (and sorry for not knowing your names…)!

title: Belle chambre et personnel serviable à 2 pas de Times Square
text:
L'emplacement est génial, à quelques pâtés de maisons de Times Square ou de Bryant Park. 
L'hôtel est moderne et très propre. La chambre n'est pas grande mais assez confortable. Personnel très gentil et serviable. 
Petit souci avec le petit déjeuner ( copieux ) où quelques produits servis ( petits pots de confiture notamment ) étaient périmés...
Attention aussi aux " fees" qui ne sont généralement pas annoncés lorsque l'on réserve et qui peuvent vite faire augmenter la note.
Beau souvenir cependant.

title: Holiday
text: Just spent 5 nights here ,everything about this place is Great rooms very comfortable and clean ,staff are absolutely  lovely especially marilyn at reception who has a smile as big as the big apple itself n made our time in NYC so much better thanks again and can't wait too return here someday🇮🇪❤

title: Ubicación y servicio fantástico
text:
La ubicación perfecta: a 5 minutos de Times Square, a 2 minutos del metro que conectaba con el aeropuerto entre otras ubicaciones y a 10 minutos de la quinta avenida.
El hotel muy limpio. El equipo de limpieza de las habitaciones muy rápido y eficaz, creo que pasaban varias veces a lo largo del día, lo cual se agradece mucho.
En recepción te ayudan en lo que necesites, nos dieron mapas de la ciudad y coincidimos con una persona que hablaba en español. También nos guardaron las maletas sin problema el último día después de hacer el check out.
La cama de la habitación muy cómoda, muebles modernos y funcionales.
En Nueva York cobran una tasa diaria a los turistas, al llegar al hotel te lo explican todo a la perfección antes de hacerte los cargos.
Sin duda, un hotel muy cómodo si buscas un sitio limpio, moderno y bien ubicado en la ciudad.

title: Nice but they still haven’t refund me!
text:
The hotel in general was nice, comfy and the staff was very friendly and caring! 

In another note, they told me at my checkout at February 8,2022 that they would refund my $400 security, shortly after checkout. It’s been almost 4 weeks since I left the hotel and nothing! 

I wrote two emails (in different weeks) and still no response from anybody. This situation it’s very unfortunate for me because the hotel was great.

title: Great Stay!
text: This hotel  is super well located just a few minutes walking to Times Squares and the Hudson gardens. The subway is also very close. The rooms are modern and very comfortable. The reception area and the bar are very cool and the staff is great!

title: A mudança pode melhorar seu descanso
text: A mudança do Manager do Pestana East para o CR7 fez realmente a diferença; talvez o problema fosse o cara que precedeu Aztra; Marilyn na recepção também é mais otimista. Assim como todos na equipe - sorrisos calorosos no check-in, todos que trabalham no hotel me perguntando se há alguma coisa que eu preciso, como estou aproveitando minha estadia, qualquer coisa que possam fazer para melhorá-la. Nova Iorque tem fama de ser impessoal mas não no Pestana CR7. Agora estou realmente ansioso para voltar aqui e ficar em outros CR7 também.

title: L'étoile brille
text: C'est un nouvel hôtel très bien situé. Les chambres sont petites mais elles sont impeccables. Le service est de premier ordre et j'attribue cela à la femme qui le gère.  Elle s’appelle Astra et elle est la gerante de l’entretien ménager.  Je ne croix pas qu’il y a un vrai directeur pour l’hotel, mais ce n’est pas grave car Astra est la.  Elle est une vraie etoile!

title: Excelente calidad/ precio
text: Excelente Calidad/precio. Bien ubicado para ir andando a casi todo Manhattan. Barios restaurantes cerca para poder comer y cenar. Personal muy atento y amable, especialmente Marilyn. Habitaciones  limpias . El 50% de los empleados habla español.

title: Great stay at Pestana CR7!!
text:
Had a great stay at this hotel, perfectly placed for Times Square, just across from the subway and various shops, McDonald’s and a 7-11 just at the top of the street. 
Hotel was very clean throughout and all the reception staff were friendly and welcomed us upon arrival. 
Room and bathroom were adequate in size, steamer and hairdryer in room were great. Yes the air conditioning is loud, take some earplugs and you’ll be fine!! After a busy day sightseeing not much would keep me awake! 
I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

title: Not what we were expecting
text: I was very disappointed with the experience at the hotel. My friends and I arrived and were told we had to pay a refundable $400 deposit as well as $120 facilities fee which was not outlined before we arrived despite at the time of booking stating all fees are included. The room pictures prior to arrival looked nothing like what they were in actuality, they were extremely small. There was also no storage or desk space to put anything. We asked to move and the manager was kind enough to put us in a bigger room. However, cleanliness wasn’t great, the bathroom floor had dust in the corners and our towels were not replaced with clean towels everyday. Our toilet kept braking which resulted in calling someone to fix it every day. The bottles of water in the room were $5 each. I’ve not stayed in any hotel where bottles of water aren’t complimentary. Overall the hotel was a in a decent location but should be marketed as a 2* at best.

title: Great place to stay in Manhattan
text: Location is great, just few blocks from Times Square or Bryant Park. Hotel is modern and very clean. Room is not big but comfortable enough. Staff very kind and helpful. I would stay in Pestana again for sure.

title: In centro ma nulla di più …
text:
Nulla di che … Camere piccole e colazione scarsa … L unica cosa è che si trova vicino a time square … La ragazza che serviva le colazione la mattina aveva modi gentili mentre il ragazzo  era un po’ scontroso … Comunque se volete un consiglio dovete aumentare la professionalità … 
Ps: Almeno date delle divise …

title: No me vuelvo a hospedar aquí
text: Llegamos al hotel y nos dieron una habitación que parecía refrigerador, el aire se filtra por las ventanas, nos dieron un "ascenso" a una habitación más cálida y todo bien con eso, al otro dia nos hablan de frontdesk a las 7:00 a.m. porque no coincidía mi nombre con la habitación y nos arruinaron el descanso. A los pocos días no nos hicieron la limpieza de la habitación. La TV no funcionó durante toda la estancia. En el checkout mi tarjeta y la de mi novia no funcionó, funcionó en TODAS las tiendas y restaurantes que fuimos en NY incluso con cobros mayores a la estancia completa en el Pestana, pero en el hotel pestana no funcionó con cargos altos y tuvimos que pagar de poco en poco, lo cual fue muy molesto y se les hizo sencillo culpar al banco. Lo rescatable fue Joana en frontdesk que me ayudo a recuperar una bolsa que olvide en recepción, fue muy amable. Y no tiene nada de Cristiano Ronaldo, lo cual me pareció engañoso.

title: No reservar - añaden fees sin avisar al total ya pagado y cobran minibar no usado tras salir del hotel
text:
BE CAREFUL WITH YOUR CREDIT CARD
CUIDADO CON LA TARJETA
We have had to frozen de card.
Hemos tenido que congelar la tarjeta. 

After checkout, the hotel made a charge in our credit card. They keep your data. Besides that, without notice they added a new invoice of 160 dolars, when we prepaid the total stay weeks before (including taxes and fees) reclaming a new fee that its not included at the confirmation or any email to inform about that. You have to add a deposit at the checkin too, then expects to add at the supposed total of stay: 400 deposit, 160 fees (more if you stay more than 7 days) and 9 of something after the checkout. 

Tras salir del hotel recibimos un cargo en nuestra tarjeta, por lo que se quedan con tus datos y realizan cargos sin permiso del cliente. Ahora nos dicen que es del minibar que no usamos. 
También nos hicieron un cargo extra en el checkout de 160 dólares cuando ya habíamos prepagado toda la estancia, incluidos tasas y gastos. Como en el checkin haces un depósito, según el hotel para cubrir si rompes algo o haces algo a la habitación, al salir te meten esta nueva tasa y ya no tienes posibilidad de no pagarlo ya que te lo cogen del depósito hecho en el checkin. Sobre esta tasa no avisan al reservar ni en el mail de confirmación, ni en el checkin. 
Por lo que al total con tasas, añade 400 de depósito, 160 fees (más dependiendo de los días) y minibar no usado.
Todo lo hacen con malicia,unos fees que no indican al reservar ni al llegar y cobran del depósito, y un minibar al salir cuando ya no tienes como reclamarlo.

title: Um flop!
text:
Disastro assoluto, camere minuscola, lo spazio non è sufficiente nemmeno per aprire due valigie contemporaneamente, le camera non ha armadi è l’unico spazio addebito per i vestiti è veramente piccolo, il bagno non ha alcun piano di appoggio per gli cosmetici…
Servizio in generale assente, la pulizia della camera da rivedere, alle 18 non avevamo ancora la camera pulita, cambio delle asciugamani fatto solo per una persona e non per due. 
Colazione assolutamente da evitare, con il custo non proprio regalato, il buffet è poverissimo e sopratutto senza alcuna variazione, pomodori e patate al forno, uova e bacon o uova e salsicce, pancake e poco altro. Forse per chi fa un soggiorno breve potrebbe ancora andare ma se si prenota per una settimana è meglio evitare. 
Questa mattina ci siamo trovati a fare colazione nella hall che era ghiacciata, il personale avevano addosso le giacche, senza nemmeno un tavolino di appoggio con piatì e posate di plastica e sopratutto senza alcun preavviso che la sala collazione fosse chiusa per problemi tecnici, il cameriere con la sua solita antipatia ci ha invitato a fare colazione in camera solo che avremo dovuto arrangiarci,  o sia riempire i piattini di plastica in dotazione e portarci  su 😠 
Mi spiace ma non ci siamo, l’ospitalità non sanno nemmeno cosa sia, personale scorbutici poco atento al cliente e al limite della maleducazione, mai un sorriso un buongiorno nulla di nulla… insomma una esperienza da non ripetere!

title: Very disappointing
text:
The hotel is located very conveniently, only a few minutes to Times Square and the room was nice, good size and clean. There was really nothing wrong with the room, the staff was also very helpful. That much to the positive.
However, a deposit of US$400 was deducted and I was informed that this would be returned about 4 weeks after departure. Because of the TV not working properly during my whole stay - 6 nights - I was assured to receive a discount.
After more than 2 months, the Hotel is not reacting to my emails I have sent informing them that I am still waiting for the deposit and the refund they had promised me. I find it utterly unprofessional and wonder if this is how Pestana CR7 Times Square is trying to make some extra money. While the hotel is nice, the communication is non existent, they completely ignore my trying to contact them. I will, however, not give up until they return to me what they owe me!

title: Less than average
text: To our dismay, the Pestana CR7 Times Square Hotel was an overall disappointing experience. Good location. While our check-in process was straightforward, our hotel room was lack luster. The size of the room was tiny and the layout of the furniture made the room feel even smaller. Our night stands and in-room telephone were covered in dust, and our shower still had a layer residue on the floor and door. Thank goodness my partner and I are of smaller build as it would be impossible for a heavier set individual to fit in between the door and the wall in the bathroom to get access to both the toilet and shower. We were even feeling the pinch trying to get through! Ridiculous. Certainly not well thought out by the interior designer/contractors. Most of the hotel staff were pleasant. But as they say, “There is always one”. We found this “one” to be working at the front desk of the hotel. No smile, no passion, and certainly no drive to go above and beyond for any guest. The hotel bar located in the lobby was always closed. For those reading, please save yourself the money. Put that money towards a stay at a hotel with better standards for customer service, on-premise facilities and cleanliness. Do not let the website photos fool you or the affiliation with football celebrity, Cristiano Ronaldo. It is not worth it.

title: 3 week stay - highly recommend
text: Highly recommend! I loved my stay so much that I kept extending the reservation - 3 total weeks. Great room. Check-in & service is fantastic. Giovanni is phenomenal. The gym is fantastic. No frills: treadmill, weights, towels, and a Peloton!

title: Ojo! No devuelven la garantía.
text:
Me hospedé hace 3 meses en el hotel. Te cobran una garantía en la tarjeta de crédito al ingresar como en cualquier establecimiento, pero vengo reclamando el reembolso hace 3 meses y no me dan ninguna respuesta, encima me cobraron dos veces!!
No volevería más por el mal rato y la pésima atención pos venta.

title: Great hotel
text:
Loved staying at this beautifully designed hotel. The location is great and the front desk staff were very friendly and professional (especially Marilyn and Joanna).
Thank you, I'll definitely be back :)

title: OVERCHARGED - won't go back
text:
Was quoted a price for room and resort fee. At checkout, we agreed on the room fees of $507.67.  The disagreement was on the resort fee. We were quoted $22.95 per day for 4 days is $91.80.  At checkout, we were charged $180.76 resort fee. We asked and did not receive an explanation, nor did we receive a refund.

Also, the bathroom was so small. To close the door you had to slide in beside the toilet. Location good-close to Port Authority and Times Square.

title: Hidden fees, come on
text: The reservation made via their own website had $20+ a night “facility fees”, hidden in fine print. The manager tried telling me in a PR person denial tone that “many NY hotels have facility fees” (not true) and that “it’s fine print, so it is not cheating”. Insulting and disrespectful.

title: Very clean and central but..
text:
Pros

Very clean hotel.. Helpful staff (kudos to Merellana if I spelled the name correctly) .. Big rooms by Manhattan standards.. Strong WiFi and around 5-7 mins walk to Times Square

Cons

Watch out for their website rates, the final price is not the actual price you pay.. They add 20$/night for things like coffee and tea and some discount coupons which is a total rip off imo
The location though central yet not much to do in 39th Street unlike other streets also off times Square

title: Great stay in Hell’s
text: From the moment we checked in, we were pleasantly surprised at the intelligently planned and executed use of space and quality of amenities throughout the hotel. The hotel’s proximity to EVERYTHING great about NYC is wonderful. The staff is friendly and very helpful. We’ll definitely be back to this modern and chic hotel.

title: Hotel nuevo en Times Square
text: Es un hotel nuevo, por lo que toda su infraestructura es asi, la hbaitación en nuestro caso era de 2 csmas dobles de buena densidad y super comodas para dormir, tiene toma corrientes y cargas usb, csja fuerte, cafetera con cápsulas, plancha a vapor y frigobar vacío, solo para mantener tus productos y sirve mucho en verano. tiene aire acondicionado y al menos nuestra habitación tenia vista al empire state. cambiaron todos los dias las toallas, solo un punto negativo, que en nuestro caso nos quedamos 10 días, y 2 de ellos no nos ordenaron la habitación. Es lo único, el hotel es lindo, a dos pasos de time square y del metro. Repito, el hotel al ser nuevo lo hace ver moderno y con sus artefactos en perfectas condiciones su fincionamiento. 2 ascensores, nosotros estabamos en el piso 23. Hay servicio de desayuno con costo adicional, nosotros lo vimos y mmmm no era muy variado asi que preferimos tomarlo fuera del hotel.

title: Great affordable stay!
text: Great experience! This was literally the cheapest hotel we could find for our dates that had its own private bathroom. We were pleased to find that the air conditioning throughout the hotel and especially in our room was so nice and cold in the middle of summer. Room was compact but clean and had everything we needed. We enjoyed our stay and originally wanted to cut it short by a day, but upon seeing the room and facilities we decided to keep our reservation! My husband used the gym and was the only person there. Thank you to all the staff, Jiovanni and Marilyn at the front desk for allowing a late checkout!

title: Great Experience
text: Location was perfect. The room was great. It was big enough for my family. We were very pleased with how cleaned it was. We stayed in one of the upper floors and we had a great view of the city. The staff was very welcoming. It was a great experience overall.
